alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Harris; Marion; Muscogee; Stewart; Talbot (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 5:20PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Marion, Muscogee, Chattahoochee, northern Stewart, western Talbot and southeastern Harris Counties through 545 PM EST ... At 520 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Ellerslie to Custer Road Terrace to near Twin Springs, and moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Talbotton, Cusseta, Waverly Hall, Geneva, Fort Moore, North Fort Moore, Upatoi, Ellerslie, Juniper, Vista Terrace, Cataula, Columbus Metropolitan Airport, Baughville, Renfroe, Oakland, Manta, Omaha, Eelbeck/West Fort Moore, Benning Hills, and Benning Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Chattahoochee; Harris; Marion; Muscogee; Stewart; Talbot
